content:
I reviewed [redacted name] today following completion of adjuvant gemcitabine chemotherapy for his stage I papillary urothelial carcinoma of the right renal pelvis. He underwent right nephroureterectomy on March 15th 2024 which showed a pT1 high-grade tumor with TERT mutation detected on molecular analysis. No lymphovascular invasion was identified and margins were clear.

He has completed 3 cycles of single-agent gemcitabine given the relatively early stage disease but high-grade pathology. Treatment has been well-tolerated with only grade 1 fatigue and occasional nausea well-controlled with standard antiemetics. His renal function has remained stable throughout treatment with latest creatinine 98 umol/L. Performance status remains excellent at ECOG 0.

Surveillance CT chest/abdomen/pelvis performed last week shows no evidence of disease recurrence. Cystoscopy by the urology team was also normal. Given completion of planned adjuvant therapy and satisfactory disease status, we will now move to standard surveillance protocol with 3-monthly clinical reviews alternating between oncology and urology teams. Next oncology review will be in 3 months with repeat imaging.
